meanings.definition: Every one of two or more people or things considered separately.
meanings.sent2: The teacher gave each student a pencil.
meanings.sent3: The classroom had a desk for each student.
meanings.sent4: In the library, each book seemed to have a story to tell.
meanings.sent5: The apples were placed in a row, each one perfectly ripe.

meanings.definition: To or for each; for each one.
meanings.sent1: She will each out a cookie to everyone.
meanings.sent2: Please each the candies evenly among the kids.
meanings.sent3: The magician will each a card from his deck.
meanings.sent4: The sun eaches its warm rays to every corner of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully eaches the ingredients into the mixing bowl.
